title: Why don't we get a set amount of dodges per 24hrs
body:
picture this. 
Youre in your promos, playing with your duo and his in them as well. you've got 4 wins straight and your on a roll. you get the free win and your 1-0 looks good. OH NO! its a bad game you have a toxic mid laner who is carrying hate from a previous game or pent up issues from his social life. you lose the game. you shake the tilt off and go again, besides your 1-1 back to the rift. Next game he is in your lobby and starts to trash talk you from the get go. here is my problem. no one in the lobby will dodge and your duo (understandably) doesn't want to dodge either. Why should i have to cop a Loss on my promo and lose the entire thing because this toxic player has decided he is going to ruin my promos ?

If you got like 2 dodges per 24hours what harm could come of this? im sure there are 100s of situations that would benefit from this. 'if get a toxic group' 'a player bans your champs or locks it in in spite' Ect.

you cant even report a player for doing this. 
Back on to the grind i suppose.

replies.body: Simple, coding and such will be a hellish job. I too can relate to your situation. But riot just wants to milk your money not feedback. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Add in more skins for champs and ignore the player base while the community continues to get more out of control. 
there are heaps of good ideas here that will never see the light of day. Sad really.
Indeed, only darkness like Varus's pit of darkness.

Because this would raise queue times considerably and add to the frustration. Ofc it would be nice to have in promos particularly if you have someone who declares they are going to int but If everyone got two free dodges a day, people will just dodge for stuff they just don't like. 

Teammate picks a non-meta champion? Dodge

Someone got autofilled? Dodge

Someone bans/takes your pick? Dodge

If given a free pass, people will just abuse it for any little thing they don't agree with and if you have 10 people each lobby who could just drop out without risk because there is something they don't like, it's just going to make the system worse then it is.
